pullRequest.title: Rename files written by PageSink
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR enables the workers to send / receive metadata requests /responses from coordinator.
If this feature is enabled for Hive, then all the files written by the HivePageSink for a given partition will have increasing whole numbers as file names. (For ex: Lets say this we enabled this feature and ds=2020-09-30 is written by HivePageSink. Then we can expect the file names of that partition to be 0,1,2,3..N etc ).
depended by facebookexternal/presto-facebook#1125
== RELEASE NOTES ==
Hive Changes
* Add support for file renaming for Hive connector. This can be enabled with ``hive.file_renaming_enabled`` configuration property

nodes.bodyText: I think we can directly inject ConnectorDistributedMetadataUpdater into the underlying page sink provider then passing through SPI? The design principle is to keep spi as simple as possible

ConnectorMetadataUpdateHandle updateMetadata(ConnectorSession session, ConnectorMetadataUpdateHandle handle)
Likely you can squeeze input and output into one object. But if not, feel free to create two handle interfaces
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -700,6 +702,14 @@ default void revokeTablePrivileges(ConnectorSession session, SchemaTableName tab
         throw new PrestoException(NOT_SUPPORTED, "This connector does not support page sink commit");
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Handles metadata update requests and sends the results back to worker
+     */
+    default List<MetadataUpdateResult> updateMetadata(List<MetadataUpdateRequest> metadataUpdateRequests, String queryId)

nodes.bodyText: Within a connector, we need to use the concrete implementation as much as possible. Just downcast

Map<...>
I think the key should be a pair of QueryId and partition values
not used

We might need to inject something light-weighted to track the lifecycle of a query. SqlTaskManager is the closest I can think of. But that is too heavy and not accessible through connectors. We may in the end hook callbacks from HivePageSink to remove dead queries.
clean up hashmap by hooking it to HiveFileWriter::commit/rollback
add an assertion to any integration or smoke tests to assert we don't leak requests. Check 9f89256 as an example
use removeIf
tabeName, partitionValues, fileName -> count

addMetadataUpdateRequest((tableName, partitionValues)/Path, writerIndex)
add checkState to make sure the input is alway unique

in this function, when you create a new writer, add a new request
// new writer -> table, partition, fileName?? 1:1 writer index
Add jmx counters to track the sizes of the map and queue
Ideally, renaming can happen here. But let's leave it for now and revisit this in the next iteration

nodes.bodyText: final
Not a big fan of making this thing mutable here. I think we could make it immutable wither in TableWriterOperatorFactory's constructor or somewhere even higher level.

nodes.bodyText: one param per line for function compileProjection
I guess you don't need this as it has already been bound below.
Use SchemaTableName
Just use UUID maybe
Use Optional<String>; same for the one below
fileName. Also add a comment to explain when it would be non-null
Seems missing a field here.
redundant
... ImmutableList.builder<>();
Is this thread-safe? Wonder what would happen if two threads set the same future. Might be fine, but worth digging and comment here.
Shall we have more multi-threading tests for this class?

Let's put some comments to the data structures. BTW, seems we don't need a Queue type for hiveMetadataRequestQueue because there is no order. But let's keep that because we might come back to getPendingMetadataUpdateRequests and optimize it. The current impl for getPendingMetadataUpdateRequests is a bit brute force.

This looks like an expensive call directly executed from HTTP thread (from TaskResource.updateMetadataResults). Potentially, this will exhaust jetty threads. A good way is to make it async and move it to a CPU thread.
use isPresent rather than making it null
PageSinkContext pageSinkProperties: seems you forgot to change the param names from the type renaming

afterCommit.message:
Disable listFiles call to underlying storage

Get the filenames and filesizes from Metastore partition object
and use them to create splits. This way we can avoid listFiles()
call to underlying storage.

nodes.bodyText: Use QueryId as the type for the second param

We should use a concurrent hash map or something like to to remember everything. We purged finished queries by adding a callback to QueryManager.addStateChangeListener. Note that the callback itself could unfortunately introduce another interface in connector metadata. Let me know if you might come up with better solution than that.
We don't need this if we have good way to purge queries

and use them to create splits. This way we can avoid listFiles()
call to underlying storage.

static
Do we wanna start with new AtomicLong(1)? Actually, check the bucketed case. If bucketed file name started with 1 then we can use AtomicLong(1); otherwise AtomicLong(0).
TEST_QUERY_ID
List<String> aggregatedFileNames = new ArrayList<>(fileNames);
Do we actually need this?
It's ok to remove multiple times as long as we can make sure they are cleaned up
if (!metadataUpdateRequests.getMetadataUpdates().isEmpty())

commit.message:
Piggyback MetadataUpdateRequests to coordinator as part of TaskInfo

Collect all the metadata update requests and send them to coordinator
as part of the TaskInfo.
Add new POST {taskId}/metadataresults endpoint on worker
POST the metadata results to worker
Add config parameters to enable hive file renaming
Add integration tests for file renaming
